title: The S algorithm for top
body:
Had quite a few games where top feeds, abandons lane to come to mid/bot and somehow gets S with even kill/death, sometimes more death than kills, it would appear the formula was made to detect whether top comes to help other lanes and the duration they stay in other lanes racks up some kind of hidden metric score, similar to how support gets S with just 1-2 kills. 

Anyone had similar sightings?

replies.body: No its because they had a team effort, you can be a 0/7/3 top but you tanked x4 the damage every1 else on your team did, which is well above average, so being above average you get a higher rank. Its the same as going supp yasuo getting 0/0/0 23 still get S, because its better than other supp yasuos. Same jungle yasuo, thats really easy to get S on, because every1 is bad at jg yasuo
Ahh I see I will test this out a bit more. Come to think of it in both cases they have been feeding = a lot of damage taken, and also using class not common for top.
